Core¶

class anyactions.core.procedure.hub.ActionHub(env={}, model_provider='openai', api_dir_path='.actions/', observer=False)¶

This is the main class for managing tools and API calls.

act(response_object)¶

Execute the action based on response object and return the raw response

call(action_name, input_params)¶

call tool functions directly without model

tools(tool_list)¶

Initialize a set of tool definitions available to LLM It loads existing local tools and use retriever to set up new tools If the entry in tool_list is a dictionary, it is treated as the tool definition directly

Parameters:

tool_list (List[str | dict]) – List of tool names or tool definitions

Raises:

  • Exception – tool definition parsing failed

  • ValueError – tool definition is not in the correct format

Returns:

tool definition list

Return type:

List[dict]

verification(api_name)¶

_summary_ @deprecated TODO: Currently it keeps 3rd party API keys locally

This function checks if an API key is needed for the specified API, and if so, attempts to retrieve from local api index or create one. It handles both APIs that require keys and those that don’t.

Parameters:

api_name (str) – The name of the API to verify.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • status (bool): True if verification was successful, False otherwise.

  • provider_name (str): The name of the API provider.

  • action_name (str): The name of the specific API action.

  • inter_api_key (str or None): The API key if required, None otherwise.

Return type:

tuple

Raises:

ValueError – If creation of a required API key fails.
